properties.name: operation
properties.description: Get event by ID

options.name: Get
options.description: Get event by ID

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many events

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the events belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: projectSlug
properties.description: The slug of the project the events belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: full
properties.description: Whether the event payload will include the full event body, including the stack trace

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the events belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: projectSlug
properties.description: The slug of the project the events belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: eventId
properties.description: The ID of the event to retrieve (either the numeric primary-key or the hexadecimal ID as reported by the raven client)

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Delete an issue

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete an issue

options.name: Get
options.description: Get issue by ID

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many issues

options.name: Update
options.description: Update an issue

properties.name: issueId
properties.description: ID of issue to get

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the issues belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: projectSlug
properties.description: The slug of the project the issues belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: An optional Sentry structured search query. If not provided, an implied "is:unresolved" is assumed. Info here.

options.name: query
options.description: An optional Sentry structured search query. If not provided, an implied "is:unresolved" is assumed. Info here.

options.name: statsPeriod
options.description: Time period of stats

options.name: shortIdLookUp
options.description: Whether short IDs are looked up by this function as well. This can cause the return value of the function to return an event issue of a different project which is why this is an opt-in.

properties.name: issueId
properties.description: ID of issue to get

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The actor ID (or username) of the user or team that should be assigned to this issue

options.name: assignedTo
options.description: The actor ID (or username) of the user or team that should be assigned to this issue

options.name: hasSeen
options.description: Whether this API call is invoked with a user context this allows changing of the flag that indicates if the user has seen the event

options.name: isBookmarked
options.description: Whether this API call is invoked with a user context this allows changing of the bookmark flag

options.name: isPublic
options.description: Whether to set the issue to public or private

options.name: status
options.description: The new status for the issue

properties.name: agreeTerms
properties.description: Whether you agree to the applicable terms of service and privacy policy of Sentry.io

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: The unique URL slug for this organization. If this is not provided a slug is automatically generated based on the name.

options.name: slug
options.description: The unique URL slug for this organization. If this is not provided a slug is automatically generated based on the name.

properties.name: operation
properties.description: Create a release

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a release

options.name: Delete
options.description: Delete a release

options.name: Get
options.description: Get release by version identifier
options.action: Get a release by version ID

options.name: Get Many
options.description: Get many releases

options.name: Update
options.description: Update a release

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the releases belong to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: returnAll
properties.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

properties.name: limit
properties.description: Max number of results to return

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: This parameter can be used to create a “starts with” filter for the version

options.name: query
options.description: This parameter can be used to create a “starts with” filter for the version

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the release belongs to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: version
properties.description: The version identifier of the release

properties.name: organizationSlug
properties.description: The slug of the organization the release belongs to. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

properties.name: version
properties.description: A version identifier for this release. Can be a version number, a commit hash etc.

properties.name: url
properties.description: A URL that points to the release. This can be the path to an online interface to the sourcecode for instance.

properties.name: projects
properties.description: A list of project slugs that are involved in this release. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

properties.name: additionalFields
properties.description: An optional date that indicates when the release went live. If not provided the current time is assumed.

options.name: dateReleased
options.description: An optional date that indicates when the release went live. If not provided the current time is assumed.

options.name: commits
options.description: An optional list of commit data to be associated with the release

values.name: patchSet
values.description: A list of the files that have been changed in the commit. Specifying the patch_set is necessary to power suspect commits and suggested assignees.

values.name: path
values.description: The path to the file. Both forward and backward slashes are supported.

values.name: type
values.description: The types of changes that happened in that commit

options.name: refs
options.description: An optional way to indicate the start and end commits for each repository included in a release

values.name: commit
values.description: The head sha of the commit

values.name: previousCommit
values.description: The sha of the HEAD of the previous release

notes.name: Notes
notes.description: Optional note to save with the node

notesInFlow.name: Display Note in Flow?
notesInFlow.description: If active, the note above will display in the flow as a subtitle

alwaysOutputData.name: Always Output Data
alwaysOutputData.description: If active, will output a single, empty item when the output would have been empty. Use to prevent the workflow finishing on this node

executeOnce.name: Execute Once
executeOnce.description: If active, the node executes only once, with data from the first item it receives

retryOnFail.name: Retry On Fail
retryOnFail.description: If active, the node tries to execute again when it fails

maxTries.name: Max. Tries
maxTries.description: Number of times to attempt to execute the node before failing the execution

waitBetweenTries.name: Wait Between Tries (ms)
waitBetweenTries.description: How long to wait between each attempt (in milliseconds)

onError.name: On Error
onError.description: Action to take when the node execution fails

options.name: Stop Workflow
options.description: Halt execution and fail workflow

options.name: Continue
options.description: Pass error message as item in regular output

options.name: Continue (using error output)
options.description: Pass item to an extra `error` output

settings.note: Executable nodes have both common and executable settings
